result.text:
You can quickly find information in a list by sorting, filtering, and searching the list.

 

Sorting Lists - List v3

A. Sort by column name - Click a column heading to sort the list in ascending order. Click again to sort in descending order.

B. Sort by list context menu - Click the menu icon or right-click the column heading to access the list context menu. You can select Sort (a to z) or Sort (z to a).

 

Sorting Lists - List v2

A. Sort by column name - Click a column heading to sort the list in ascending order. Click again to sort in descending order.

B. Sort by list context menu - Click the menu icon or right-click the column heading to access the list context menu. You can select Sort (a to z) or Sort (z to a).

  

Filtering Lists - List v3

A. Filter by condition builder - To open the condition builder, click the filter icon by the breadcrumbs. Restrict what records appear by adding one or more conditions, which include fields, operators, and values. Click Save Filter to keep the filter for future use. Click Run to apply the filter.

B. Quick filters - To quickly filter a list using a value in a field, right-click in the field and select Show Matching or Filter Out. (For date fields, choose from Show Before, Show After, and Filter Out.)

 

Filtering Lists - List v2

A. Filter by condition builder - To open the condition builder, click the filter icon by the breadcrumbs. Restrict what records appear by adding one or more conditions, which include fields, operators, and values. Click Save to keep the filter for future use. Click Run to apply the filter.

B. Quick filters - To quickly filter a list using a value in a field, right-click in the field and select Show Matching or Filter Out. (For date fields, choose from Show Before, Show After, and Filter Out.)

 

 

Searching Lists - List v3 and List v2 

 

A. Search a list - Select a field to search and enter keywords in the adjacent search field. Press the Enter key to perform the search.

B. Search individual columns - Click the search icon to display a search field under each column. Enter keywords in the search field for one or more columns and press the Enter key. To clear a column search, delete the text in the search field and press the Enter key.

Lists and forms are the most common ways to interact with data. A form displays information from one record in a data table.

  

Basic Structure

A. Form header - Provides navigation tools and actions related to the record.

B. Field - Stores specific data, such as the record name or number.

C. Sections - Group related information on the form. Users can collapse or display sections using tabs.

D. Related links - Perform additional actions related to the record.

E. Related lists - Display records from other tables that have relationships to the current record.

Live Feed is a social IT application in your instance where users can post and share content with other users. This content is searchable and is a great way to share information within your organization.

Reports are lists, charts, or calendar-based views of filtered data from a table. Many applications provide useful reports by default. You can also create custom reports for personal use or to share.

 

A. View all reports - Navigate to Reports > View / Run to see all the reports you have permission to view.

 

 

A. Open a report - Click a report name, such as All Incidents by Category. This report shows the types of incidents that are consuming most of your employees’ time.

We provide many useful reports, but creating your own is a simple process. In this example, we will create a report that groups all open incidents by escalation level and stacks them by priority. This report illustrates whether the highest-priority incidents are resolved before they are escalated.

 

 

  1. Navigate to Reports > Create New.
  2. On the Data tab, enter a report Name.
  3. Set Data Table to Incident.
  4. On the Type tab, set Type to Bar or to another chart of your choice.
  5. On the Configuration tab, set Group by to Escalation.
  6. Set Stacked by to Impact.
  7. Open the filter icon in the left pane and add the filter condition [Escalation] [is not] [Normal].
  8. Click Run to see the results.

 

The report shows that 11 of the 14 overdue incidents are high priority.

A: Click Save to add this report to your list of existing reports.

Users with the chat_admin role can track important metrics with the Connect Support manager dashboard.

 

Reporting Metrics

A. High-level performance information about support agents, queues, and sessions, updated in real time.

B. Metrics to break down performance by agents and queues. 

C. Metrics to track performance of individual agents and queues

D. Trending reports over time - volume of your chats.

Get familiar with the main components of the workspace and learn about homepages.

 

Basic Structure

A. Banner frame - Runs across the top of every page in the workspace.

B. Application navigator - Provides access to all available applications and modules, favorites, and recently viewed items.

C. Homepage - Appears when you first sign in.

 

Banner Frame

A. User menu - View your user profile or log out. Additional actions are available for administrators.

B. Connect - Toggle the Connect sidebar, where you can chat, work with records, and share files with other users.

C. Global search - Search the instance for matching records.

D. Help - Discover answers to your questions quickly with a tour of What’s New and links to the User Guide and Product Documentation.

E. System settings - Edit personal settings for the instance to customize the look and feel. Developer tools are available to users with certain roles.

 

Application Navigator

A. Navigation filter - Quickly access applications, modules, and favorites.

B. All applications - View all applications and modules.

C. Application menu - Click to expand or collapse modules for the application.

D. Module - Click to open the link. Most modules open in the content frame.

E. Favorites - View or customize items you have added as favorites, such as modules, lists, or records.

F. History - View items you have recently accessed.

G. Expand/Collapse - Show or hide the application navigator.

 

Homepage

When you first log in, you see a homepage that is appropriate for your role in the system, such as an administrator or service desk user. Homepages are dashboards that contain navigational elements, functional controls, and system information.

 

A. Add content - Add a homepage item, also called a widget.

B. Switch to page - Select a different homepage to open.

C. Widget - A block of content, such as a report or list. There are several types of widgets.

D. Homepage Settings - Set the automatic refresh frequency.

E. Refresh now - Refresh all content on the homepage.

The favorites tab in the application navigator makes it easy to save things you work on frequently. There are a few ways to add items to your favorites.

 

Drag and Drop to Add Favorites from Lists

  1. Click and drag a link or breadcrumb from a list.
  2. Drop the link in the favorites tab of the application navigator.

 

 

Drag and Drop to Add Favorites from Forms

  1. Click and drag the form title.
  2. Drop the item in the favorites tab of the application navigator.

 

 

Customize the Style of a Favorite

A. Edit favorites - At the bottom of the favorites tab, click Edit Favorites. Select a favorite and customize the name, icon, and color.

 

 

Reorder Favorites

A. Reorder favorites - When you are in favorites edit mode, drag and drop a favorite to a new location in the list.

 

 

Remove a Favorite

A. Remove from favorites - Select the (-) next to the favorite.

Learn how to access the board configuration menu and rename labels.

 

Board Configuration

A. Board configuration - Click the settings icon in the upper right corner of the board to open the board configuration menu. The board configuration menu provides several options that affect the look and feel of the board.

 

 

Modifying Label Names

  1. Open the VTB flyout.
  2. Select the labels tab.
  3. Click a label name to edit it.

Learn the Connect Support essentials to stay on top of your help desk duties.

 

Common Connect Support Actions

A. Support menu - Provides support chat actions, such as Escalate, Transfer, and Create Incident.

B. Comments and work notes - Switch between posting messages as customer-facing comments and internal work notes. Work notes are perfect for tracking research on an issue before you are ready to communicate with the customer.

C. Attach file - Attach and send a file. You can also add an attachment by dragging and dropping it directly in the conversation. In Chrome browsers, you can paste an image in a conversation.

D. End session - Stops the case timer and ends the session. The case remains in your list until you remove it.

 

 

Transferring or Escalating a Case

A. Initiate a case transfer - Begin the process of transferring a case to a different agent.

B. Transfer to an agent - Choose the agent you want to transfer the case to. Be sure to choose someone who is online, which is indicated by a green dot on their avatar. You will have the option to perform a warm or cold transfer when the agent accepts the transfer.

C. Cancel a transfer - Cancel a case transfer at any time before the agent accepts it.

D. Accept or decline a transfer - Accept or decline an incoming support transfer.

E. Choose between a warm or cold transfer - Click Stay to perform a warm transfer and remain in the conversation after the transfer completes. This option is ideal, as it enables you to provide the new agent with relevant details. Click Leave to perform a cold transfer and exit the conversation.

 

 

Searching the Knowledge Base and Sharing Solutions

A. Knowledge base - Search the knowledge base for solutions. Drag and drop an article title in the conversation to share the article instantly.

 

 

Creating an Incident from a Support Case

  1. Click the support menu icon and select Create Incident.
  2. In the Document panel that appears, fill out the Incident form and click Submit. A link to the new incident appears in the conversation. The conversation history is preserved as comments and work notes in the incident activity stream.

Learn how to access additional form actions and manage attachments.

 

Additional Actions

A. Additional actions - Click the menu icon to display the form context menu, which contains additional actions such as Add to Visual Task Board, Export, and Create Favorite. The available options vary by form and may depend on your user role and which applications are installed.

 

 

Shortcut to Add an Attachment

A. Drag and drop a file anywhere on the form to add it as an attachment. 

 

Removing an Attachment

  1. Click Manage Attachments to open the Attachments window.
  2. Select the check box by any attachments you would like to remove.
  3. Click Remove.

Visual Task Boards (VTB) transform the navigation of lists and forms into an interactive graphical experience. Visual Task Boards allow you to view and update multiple task records, which appear as cards that can be moved between lanes.

 

Board Structure

A. Lane - Organizes cards on a board into a vertical group. You can reorder lanes by using the left and right arrows at the bottom of each lane.

B. Card - Represents an individual task.

C. Quick panel - Displays labels and users associated with the board. You can use the quick panel to filter cards or to quickly label or assign tasks.

D. VTB flyout - Displays tabs for recent card changes, board member administration, and label administration.

 

 

  Freeform Boards

A. Freeform boards - Display any kind of task record, including personal tasks. Members of freeform boards can add and remove task cards and lanes.

 

B. Create freeform board - You can create a new freeform board in the My Task Boards page. Freeform boards are generated with the default lanes To do, Doing, and Done, without any preexisting cards.

 

 

  Flexible Boards

A. Flexible boards - Based off a list query. Flexible boards display tasks that match the configured filter against a particular table. Members of flexible boards can add task cards, which are removed automatically when the tasks no longer match the filter conditions. Members can define custom lanes, similar to a freeform board. Any task cards you add to the board become records on the associated table.

 

B. Create a flexible board - You can create a flexible board by selecting Show Visual Task Board in the list column menu for a field that is not a reference or choice field. The default lanes are To do, Doing, and Done. Task cards are automatically generated based on the list query.

 

 

  Guided Boards

A. Guided boards - Based off a list query. Guided boards display tasks that match the configured filter against a particular table, like flexible boards. Members of guided boards can add task cards, which are removed automatically when the tasks no longer match the filter conditions. Guided board lanes correspond to field values and cannot be edited.

 

B. Create a flexible board - You can create a flexible board by selecting Show Visual Task Board in the list column menu for a reference or choice field. Each lane in a guided board represents one possible value for that column. Task cards are automatically generated based on the list query. Any task cards you add to the board become records on the associated table.

Connect Chat is a real-time messaging feature that connects you to your coworkers, bypassing email and static documents. Learn how to use it like a pro.

 

Connect Chat Interface

A. Toggle Connect sidebar - Toggle the Connect sidebar to show or hide your conversation list.

B. Conversation filter - Search within conversations you belong to. Results include conversations you have closed.

C. Create a new conversation - Start a new conversation with one or more people.

D. Chat mini window - View your conversation in a chat window on top of the standard interface.

E. Open full-screen view - Open the full-screen view of Connect Chat in a new tab, which shows all your conversations in one place and provides additional tools to manage notifications and view key information from conversations.

F. Close Connect sidebar - Hide the Connect sidebar.

 

 

Managing Connect Notifications

  1. Click the gear icon in the banner frame to open the System Settings window.
  2. In the Notifications tab, enable or disable mobile, desktop, email, and audio notifications for all your Connect conversations. You can manage your notification preferences for specific conversations later.

 

 

Chat Mini Window

A. Add user - Add a user to the conversation. This option is available for group and record conversations only.

B. View document - View the record associated with the conversation. This option is available for record conversations only.

C. New window - Open the conversation in the full-screen view of Connect Chat.

D. Collapse/Expand conversation - Hide or show the conversation.

E. Close window - Close the chat window. The conversation remains in the Connect sidebar.

F. Attach file - Attach and send a file. You can also add an attachment by dragging and dropping it directly in the conversation. In Chrome browsers, you can paste an image in a conversation.

Lists and forms are the most common ways to interact with data. A list displays a set of records from a data table. You can filter and customize lists to display the information you need.

Note: You may encounter two different versions of list functionality referred to as List v2 and List v3.  Notable differences are explained.

 

Basic Structure

A. Title bar - Displays the list title and, in some cases, the name of the specific list view.

B. Breadcrumbs - Offer a quick form of filter navigation.

C. Column headings - Display column names and provide some list controls.

D. Column header search - Provides a quick form of search within a column.

E. Fields - Display data. You can right-click a field to access more actions.

To schedule a report for the future:

  1. Navigate to Reports > Scheduled Reports.
  2. Click New.

 

 

Enter the report parameters to run and the appropriate scheduling information, including the frequency in the Run choice list and the Time. To schedule, click Submit.

There are several ways to work collaboratively on records. Learn how to use collaboration tools on the form.

  

Activity Stream

A. Activity stream - Shifts focus to the activity stream on the current form, where you can view recent updates and add comments. This icon is visible only on forms that contain activity streams.

 

 

Comments and Work Notes

Many types of tasks have journal fields to track comments and work notes.

A. Comments - Comments are public. They can be viewed by customers.

B. Work notes - Work notes are visible to internal users only. They are highlighted with yellow indicators.

C. @mention - Provide additional visibility to another user. Entering their name allows them to see the record. 

 

 

Talking About a Record

A. Email - Send an email about the current record. 

B. Follow - Follow the current record in Connect Chat. 

C. Open in Connect Chat - Open the current record in a chat mini window or the full-screen view of Connect Chat.

Connect Support is a real-time messaging feature that enables support agents to easily keep track of their support cases, quickly find solutions, and resolve problems faster.

 

 

Connect Support Interface

A. Support tab - The support tab appears next to the chat tab in the Connect sidebar. You can switch between the tabs to access your chat conversations or support cases.

B. Queues - Lists all the support queues you belong to.

C. Cases - Lists all your open support conversations, also called cases.

D. Chat mini window - Displays a conversation in a compact chat window on top of the standard interface.

E. New window - Opens the conversation in the full-screen view of Connect Support, which shows all your conversations in one place and provides additional tools to resolve your cases quickly.

F. Presence - Indicates when conversation members are viewing the conversation or typing.

 

Full-Screen View

 

A. Accept a case - Appears when a new case is ready to be accepted in one of your queues. Click the button to accept a case.

B. Support requests - Indicates the number of cases waiting to be accepted in the queue.

C. Case details - Displays basic details about the case, including the user's name and avatar.

D. Average wait time - Indicates the average amount of time it takes for someone to accept a new case in the queue.

E. Timer - Displays the total time the case has been open.

Learn how to create, find, and manage your conversations better with these tips and tricks.

 

Starting a New Conversation

A. Add user - Send a direct message to one person or create a group conversation by adding more people.

B. Send a message - Start a conversation by sending a message.

 

 

Editing Basic Conversation Details

You can customize the avatar, name, and description for a group or record conversation.

A. Edit - Click anywhere in the conversation header to the left of the icons.

 

B. Avatar - Upload an image to stand out from the crowd.

C. Name - Give your conversation a unique name.

D. Description - Add a short description for the conversation.

 

 

Working in Conversations

A. Mention a user - Get someone’s attention in a group chat by mentioning them. Enter the @ character and select a user from the list that appears.

B. View a user's profile - View a user's profile details quickly by clicking a mentioned name. The profile includes basic information and a link to send a direct message.

C. Attach a file - Attach a file the old-fashioned way.

 

D. Drag and drop to attach - Drag and drop a file directly in your conversation.

 

Viewing Link Previews

A. Record previews - Provide contextual data about internal records referenced in Connect.

B. Link previews - Provide contextual data about external links referenced in Connect.

 

 

Additional Conversation Tools

A. Info - Open the information panel to view record details (for record conversations), referenced URLs, and related records displayed in chronological order.

B. Members - Manage conversation members. Add new members, remove members, and view member profiles.

C. Attachments - View all the attachments referenced in the conversation and add attachments.

D. Notification preferences - Set your notification preferences for the conversation.

Customize your homepage to show the information you need. You can edit existing homepage widgets, rearrange them, change the homepage layout, or create a new homepage.

 

Working with Widgets

A. Add content - Add a widget to the homepage.

B. Edit - Edit the selected widget content.

C. Refresh - Refresh the widget content.

D. Edit Widget - Customize the widget title, height, and other options.

E. Close - Remove the widget from the homepage.

 

 

Rearrange Widgets

A. Drag and drop - Move a widget by dragging and dropping it in a new location.

 

 

Change Homepage Layout

Change the homepage layout to quickly rearrange all the widgets.

  1. Select Change Layout.
  2. Select a new layout from the list.

 

 

Create a New Homepage

  1. Select New page. 
  2. Select Add content and add content as needed.
  3. Edit the new homepage title as needed.

You can customize a list to display the information you need. Create quick charts from the list to visualize data.

 

Changing the Number of Rows Shown - List v3

A. Select rows per page and choose your option from the list. Note that choosing a large maximum for a list with many columns may impact performance.  

 

Changing the Number of Rows Shown - List v2

A. Click the menu icon in the title bar to display the list controls menu.

B. Select Show and choose the maximum number of rows to display per page.  Note that choosing a large maximum for a list with many columns may impact performance. 

 

Personalizing Which Columns Display - List v3

You can personalize a list to customize which columns you see. Personal list customizations do not affect what other users see in their lists.

 

A. Select Personal List Columns from the list title menu icon in the top corner of the list.

B. Select or deselect options from the Available column list.  Drag and drop the Selected columns to move to the preferred order.  

 

Personalizing Which Columns Display - List v2

A. Click the personalize list icon in the top corner of the list.

B. Add, remove, or reorder list columns.  

 

Creating Charts

You can create quick bar and pie charts to analyze data in a list.

A. Create a bar chart - Click the list context menu button by a column heading and select Bar Chart.

 

B. Create a pie chart - Click the list context menu button by a column heading and select Pie Chart.

Learn how to work with Visual Task Board cards and lanes. 

 

Adding a Card

A. You can add a new card by clicking the Add Task button at the bottom of each lane.

B. You can also add a card by clicking the more options icon in the top right corner of a lane and selecting Add Task.

 

 

Moving a Card to a Different Lane

A. Drag a card and drop it in the target lane. Note that, for guided boards, rules on the associated table may prevent you from moving a card to certain lanes or may prompt you to fill in additional fields to complete the move.

 

 

Adding Assignees and Labels to Cards

A. Adding assignees - Assignees represent ownership of task cards and the associated records. To assign a card to someone, drag and drop a user from the quick panel to the card. You can add a user as a primary or additional assignee. There can be only one primary assignee but there is no limit to the number of additional assignees per card. Note that, for flexible and guided boards, assignment rules on the associated table may restrict who you can assign a card to.

B. Adding labels - Labels help categorize tasks and visually distinguish them on your task board. To label a card, drag and drop a label from the quick panel to the card.

 

 

Removing Cards from a Board

A. Remove one card - Point to a card and click the X icon in the upper right corner. In the dialog box that appears, click the Archive button. When you archive a card, it is removed from the board but not deleted. You can restore archived cards later if you change your mind.

B. Remove all cards in a lane - Click the more options icon in the upper right corner of a lane and select Archive All Tasks. In the dialog box that appears, click the Archive button.

 

 

 

  1. Click the card you would like to remove.
  2. Click the details tab if it is not already open. Scroll down to view more options.
  3. Under Tools, click Archive. When you archive a card, it is removed from the board but not deleted. You can restore archived cards later if you change your mind.

 

Moving a Lane

A. Drag a lane by the header and drop it in the desired position.

 

Hiding or Deleting a Lane

A. Hiding a lane - You can hide a lane by clicking the more options icon in the upper right corner of a lane and selecting Hide Lane. You can show the hidden lanes from the board configuration menu.

B. Deleting a lane - You can delete a lane by clicking the more options icon in the upper right corner of a lane and selecting Delete Lane.

 

 

Editing a Flexible or Guided Board's Filter Conditions

A. Editing the board filter - You can edit the table query that defines which cards appear on a flexible or guided board. Click the board information icon and click Edit Filter to change the query.

B. Changing the lane field - You can change which field defines the lanes for a flexible or guided board. Click the board information icon and select an option for the Lane Field. If you select a lane field for a flexible board, it becomes a guided board.

Learn how to work smarter with Connect Chat. Follow records and add updates right from the chat window. Create conversations from Visual Task Boards and collaborate with the board members. Share records directly in conversations.

 

Working with Records in Connect Chat

A. User presence - See which users are viewing the record.

B. Follow/Unfollow - Click the Follow button to create and join a conversation about this record. The conversation appears in the Connect sidebar. When you are following a record, click the button again to leave the record conversation and remove it from the sidebar.

 

C. Comments and work notes - In record conversations, your messages are posted to the record as comments or work notes. Click this button to switch between comments and work notes.

 

Mentioning Users

A. @mention - Type the @ character, followed by a name to @mention someone in the activity stream and get their attention.

 

 

Connect with Visual Task Boards

A. Connect with board members - Create a conversation about the board and automatically add all board members as conversation members.

B. Real-time updates - Track board activity in the conversation as tasks are added or moved from one lane to another.

C. See details on a board - Jump directly to a task card on the board to view more details.

D. Share a board - To share a task board with your peers, drag a board from the My Task Boards page to a conversation. Note that conversation members will only be able to access the board if they are members of the board.

 

 

Sharing a Record in a Conversation

There are several easy ways to share a record in a Connect Chat conversation. Keep in mind that access rules may prevent some users from opening certain records you share.

A. Share a record from a list - Drag a record link from a list and drop it in a conversation.

B. Share a record from a form - Drag the record title and drop it in a conversation.

C. Share a record from the chat window - Enter a record number in a conversation and send it as a message.

D. View shared records - Click a record preview in a conversation to open the record.

Tags provide a flexible way to organize records. Tags are not linked to tables, so you can use the same tag for all kinds of records. For example, you can create a High priority tag and add it to your most important incidents, tasks, and requests.

 A. Add a tag - To view or edit the tags on a record, click the more options icon in the form header. Click Add Tag and enter a value to tag the record.

 

B. View your tagged documents - Navigate to Self Service > My Tagged Documents to view a dashboard of all your tagged documents.
